Articles.Content: Is it possible to revert my game back to version 0.19.1? That was the last version that I was able to run smoothly on my laptop. All of the newer versions run at 5fps. If anyone could help, it would be greatly appreciated. I would really like to get back into the game since I haven't been able to play since may or June.
Revert - most likely not. But you can try and find the old installation files.

i know you can use the "previous stable version" in steam

but don't know if you can go back 2 versions.

----

btw, i still have a copy of 0.14

i can send you that if you want, and of cos if that doesnt break my user agreement license

There is no legal way to get two versions back, I think.

Please don't get me wrong but we don't know if you bought the game. You could contact a mod and ask him about old versions.

And I am not sure if we are allowed to give game versions that aren't downloadable anymore to other players.

Can you build a rocket this looks like this and post a screenshot?

Edited September 6, 2013 by Crown

I don't think it's possible to do that.

You could try deleting some parts you don't use out of the game directory though, that should help the performance somewhat.
Also, isn't there that cfg fix you can do with the oceans to help with Kerbin lag?

The max physics delta-time slider in the game settings menu has a huge impact on how the game runs. I play with mine set all the way to the right. Sometimes the game runs in slo-mo, but remains smooth and responsive, instead of a glitchy slide-show, and I'm on a 5 year old Gateway laptop with integrated graphics.
my friend made a mod of sorts that boost's peformance. it's still in need of alot of work.
also, i suggest turning off practically everything in the graphics menu anti-aliasing and v-sync help quite a lot. scatter- BE GONE!

You can rename KSP folder after unzipping and have several versions simultaneously. I have named them like "KSP-win_0.21.1". At least I want to test new version carefully before I begin any big projects. And I do not delete old versions, because I never know if some problems arise. Couple of gigabytes hard disk space is practically free today.

It is not allowed to share old installation files between users but maybe you can ask them from Squad.

Alright, thanks for the replies. I did buy the game on steam and have used the "go back to stable release" feature and it took me back to a .20 version, which is still quite a bit laggy. I will try playing with the physics slider and see if that helps.
